bug.author: dmus
bug.summary: check_consistent_affine fails when loading a saved image
bug.description:
üêõBug To reproduce the issue I encouter I save an image and load this image again, so this is the same image. However the affines seem to be slightly different (very minimal differences) which make the check_consistent_affine fail To reproduce <denchmark-code>import torchio as tio import numpy as np import torch
pdf = torch.zeros(1, 640, 580, 72)
affine = np.array([[4.27109375e-14, -8.71264808e-03, 9.99876633e-01, -3.39850907e+01], [-5.54687500e-01, -2.71630469e-12, 8.75148028e-17, 1.62282930e+02], [2.71575000e-12, -5.54619070e-01, -1.57073092e-02, 2.28515784e+02], [0.00000000e+00, 0.00000000e+00, 0.00000000e+00, 1.00000000e+00]])
sampling_map = tio.Image(tensor=pdf, affine=affine, type=tio.SAMPLING_MAP)
path = 'test_sampling_map.nii.gz' sampling_map.save(path)
sampling_map_new = tio.Image(path=path, type=tio.SAMPLING_MAP)
new_subject = tio.Subject( one=sampling_map, two=sampling_map_new )
new_subject.check_consistent_affine() </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>RuntimeError: Images "one" and "two" do not occupy the same physical space. Affine of "one": array([[ 4.27109375e-14, -8.71264808e-03, 9.99876633e-01, -3.39850907e+01], [-5.54687500e-01, -2.71630469e-12, 8.75148028e-17, 1.62282930e+02], [ 2.71575000e-12, -5.54619070e-01, -1.57073092e-02, 2.28515784e+02], [ 0.00000000e+00, 0.00000000e+00, 0.00000000e+00, 1.00000000e+00]]) Affine of "two": array([[ 3.67499773e-08, -8.71257665e-03, 9.99876635e-01, -3.39850922e+01], [-5.54687500e-01, 3.67499771e-08, 6.73024385e-08, 1.62282928e+02], [-3.73318194e-08, -5.54619071e-01, -1.57071802e-02, 2.28515778e+02], [ 0.00000000e+00, 0.00000000e+00, 0.00000000e+00, 1.00000000e+00]])
</denchmark-code>
Expected behavior I expect that loading the same image again gives me the same affine, or at least an affine that is equal enough to pass the consistent_affine check Actual behavior The consistent_affine check fails TorchIO version 0.18.4

comments.comment: Good catch! Fixed in v0.18.5. Thanks!
